The Chapter with Sihāsani
The Elder Pilindavaccha’s Birth Story
When the Lord of the World,
the foremost person Sumedha, had passed away;
With a confident and joyful mind,
I made a shrine-offering.
Those who were free from defilements there,
with the six deep knowledges and great power;
I brought them all together there,
and made a meal for the Sangha.
The Fortunate One Sumedha
was the attendant at that time;
His name was Sumedha,
and he rejoiced then.
By that confidence in my mind,
I was reborn in a divine palace;
Eighty-six thousand
sugar-cane stalks delighted me.
They all followed me,
and always had all the sensual pleasures;
I surpassed the other gods,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deeds.
In the twenty-fifth (Buddha) era,
a noble one named Varuna;
I was a pure feeder,
a Wheel-turning Monarch at that time.
They did not plough the seed,

analyzed: napi nīyanti naṅgalā  a kaṭṭha pākimam sāli
translated: nor were they led by ploughs;
Humans enjoyed rice🔽that did not need to be threshed.
Having ruled there,
I went again to the deva world.
Even then such was my prosperity,
my attainment of wealth.

original: Na maṁ mittā amittā vā,🔽hiṁsanti sabbapāṇino;
analyzed: na mam mittāḥ amittāḥ vā  hisanti sabba pāṇinaḥ
translated: Neither friends nor foes,🔽nor any living being, harmed me;
I was dear to all,
this was the fruit of my meritorious deed.
For twenty-one thousand eons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this was the fruit of the perfume and ointment.
In this auspicious aeon,
there was one king,
I was a powerful king,
a mighty universal monarch.🔽I established many people
in the five precepts,
and sent them to a good destination,
I was dear to the devas.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
the six supernormal knowledges were realized,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pilindavaccho thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā pilindavacchaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”🔽Thus spoke the venerable Pilindavaccha, the elder, these verses.
